data.prayer: Father, guide the church in Umm al-Qaywayn, United Arab Emirates to see their community as a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Umm al-Qaywayn, United Arab Emirates
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Lord, to the people of Umm al-Qaywayn you say, "If you wait for Me, I will work on your behalf."
data.verse: For from of old men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither has the eye seen a God besides you, who works for him who waits for him.

data.prayer: Holy Spirit, have mercy on the simple who turned from you in the state of Umm al-Qaywayn. Warn them again against their complacency.
data.verse: For the simple are killed by their turning away, and the complacency of fools destroys them;

data.prayer: Father, please reward those who diligently seek you with a heart of faith in the state of Umm al-Qaywayn.
data.verse: Without faith it is impossible to be well pleasing to him, for he who comes to God must believe that he exists, and that he is a rewarder of those who seek him.

data.prayer: Lord, Let your Kingdom come among the Urdu people. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.
Father, help the 527 believers in Umm al-Qaywayn to know your commands and to do them.
data.verse: For Ezra had devoted himself to the study and observance of the Law of the Lord, and to teaching its decrees and laws in Israel.

data.prayer: Lord, teach the young people in the state of Umm al-Qaywayn to trust your Word and find the path of purity.
data.verse: How can a young person stay on the path of purity? By living according to your word.

data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Umm al-Qaywayn, United Arab Emirates. Show them that faithfulness is more important than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.
